intro: Malvastrum peruvianum var. scorpioides, commonly known as the Peruvian mallow or Scorpioid mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It is often found in moist habitats such as riverbanks and wetlands.
